com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface LogService.Logger

Enclosing interface:
LogService
public static interface LogService.Logger

Handles all log messages for a single class. You can obtain an instance of this class using the LogService class.

Method Detail

debug

void debug(java.lang.String message)
Logs a non-localized message at the DEBUG level.

Parameters:
message - the message to be logged. No parameter replacement is done on this message.

debug

void debug(java.lang.String message,
           java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Logs a non-localized message at the DEBUG level.

Parameters:
message - the message to be logged. No parameter replacement is done on this message.
throwable - an exception to be included with the log message.

errorUnexpected

void errorUnexpected(java.lang.String message)
Logs a non-localized message at the ERROR level. This should only be used in the most extreme of cases where you would honestly say "That should never happen"

Parameters:
message - The message to be logged. No parameter replacement is done on this message.

errorUnexpected

void errorUnexpected(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Logs a non-localized message at the ERROR level. This should only be used in the most extreme of cases where you would honestly say "That should never happen"

Parameters:
message - The message to be logged. No parameter replacement is done on this message.
throwable - an exception to be included along with the error message.

ignoreException

void ignoreException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Used to indicate that an exception is being deliberately ignored. For example: 

    try {
    }
    catch (SomeException se) {
        // handle error: blah blah
        Logger.ignoreException("This exception was handled by doing blah. Twice.", se);
    }

The non-localized message will only be written to the logs at a DEBUG2 level.

Parameters:
message - the message explaining why the exception was ignored
throwable - the exception that was ignored.

log

void log(java.lang.String id)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.

log

void log(java.lang.String id,
         java.lang.String... params)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
params - one or more String parameters which will be inserted into the log message from the properties file in place of the markers {0}, {1}, ....

log

void log(java.lang.String id,
         java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
throwable - An exception to be included with the log message.

log

void log(java.lang.String id,
         java.lang.Throwable throwable,
         java.lang.String... params)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
throwable - An exception to be included with the log message.
params - one or more String parameters which will be inserted into the log message from the properties file in place of the markers {0}, {1}, ....

logOnce

void logOnce(java.lang.String id)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

The log message corresponding to the provided ID is logged only once, the first time it is encountered.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.

logOnce

void logOnce(java.lang.String id,
             java.lang.String... params)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

The log message corresponding to the provided ID is logged only once, the first time it is encountered.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
params - one or more String parameters which will be inserted into the log message from the properties file in place of the markers {0}, {1}, ....

logOnce

void logOnce(java.lang.String id,
             java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

The log message corresponding to the provided ID is logged only once, the first time it is encountered.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
throwable - An exception to be included with the log message.

logOnce

void logOnce(java.lang.String id,
             java.lang.Throwable throwable,
             java.lang.String... params)
Logs a localized message corresponding to the provided ID. The ID is looked up in the LogResources.properties file for the package that the calling class is in. The text and log level of the message are determined by the contents of the resource file.

The log message corresponding to the provided ID is logged only once, the first time it is encountered.

Parameters:
id - the resource ID to use when looking up the log message and severity in the resource file.
throwable - An exception to be included with the log message.
params - one or more String parameters which will be inserted into the log message from the properties file in place of the markers {0}, {1}, ....

logRaw

void logRaw(long timestamp,
            java.lang.String category,
            java.lang.String level,
            java.lang.String threadName,
            java.lang.String message,
            java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Logs an non-localized message with the given properties. This method should only be used for forwarding log messages from other logging systems.

Parameters:
timestamp - Timestamp.
category - Category name.
level - Log level name, e.g. "ERROR".
threadName - Thread name.
message - Message.
throwable - Exception.
Since:
5.6.2.6
